Enore, I think you will find this may be the wrong place to ask this 
question. You would be better off going to Bugei forum or International 
Sword Forum and asking. The members here are true conservationists and 
what you are suggest is grating on many nerves. This is not something 
that is offered in this day and age as a rule, as Mr Robson has noted it 
is not really done by the top togi in Japan. Most Hi are polished out 
over time and eventually almost disappear.

Don't feel you are being attacked personally. it is just that most true 
Nihontophiles consider this a blasphemy of sorts.

Cheers

Richard
